newsitem.title: UK: UK government to review Private Finance Initiative.
newsitem.headline: UK government to review Private Finance Initiative.

text.p: Britain's new Labour government is to conduct a rapid review of the Private Finance Initiative, Paymaster General Geoffrey Robinson said on Thursday.

The PFI, under which construction companies can build things such as hospitals, roads and other public building works and then lease them back to the government, was introduced five years ago under the Conservative government.
But it proved so complex that only a handful of projects, such as the Skye bridge, ever got built.
"It has not been a success, far from it. We are committed in our manifesto to reinvigorating the whole programme and that is why we have set up this review," Robinson told BBC radio.
He said the review would be finished by mid-June. -- London Newsroom +171-542-7947
